title: Nvidia delivers first Vera Rubin AI GPU samples to customers 88-core Vera CPU paired with Rubin GPUs with 288 GB of HBM4 memory apiece
summary: Nvidia starts shipping samples of Vera Rubin AI platforms to partners, on track for revenue shipments in the second half of the year, featuring an 88-core Vera CPU and 288 GB of HBM4 memory.
insight: AI computing capabilities get a major boost with Nvidia's Vera Rubin launch

title: Micron joins the 3GB GDDR7 party, introduces 36 Gbps modules for GPUs lags behind speeds of Samsung and SK Hynix
summary: Micron has introduced its 3GB GDDR7 memory module with a 36 Gbps bandwidth rating, marking its entry into the GDDR7 market. This move positions Micron in the growing high-speed memory sector. The company's GDDR7 modules are designed for use in high-performance graphics processing units (GPUs).
insight: Micron lags behind Samsung and SK Hynix in GDDR7 speeds.

title: Microsoft clarifies Windows 11 printer driver policy support for legacy printers is not ending
summary: Microsoft confirmed that Windows 11 will continue supporting legacy V3 and V4 printer drivers, contradicting earlier reports of an impending end to support.
insight: Legacy printer users can breathe a sigh of relief, continued support secured.

title: China to increase leading-edge chip output by 5x in two years, report claims aims to lift 7nm and 5nm production to 100,000 wafers per month, targeting half a million monthly by 2030
summary: China's foundries aim to boost 7nm and below chip production to 100,000 wafers per month within the next one or two years, aiming to reach half a million monthly by 2030.
insight: China's chip production surge could challenge global semiconductor dominance.

title: Razer Iskur V2 NewGen gaming chair review: A much-needed cooler update to an already solid chair
summary: The Razer Iskur V2 NewGen chair offers a cooler update with upgraded materials. This revised version maintains the solid foundation of its predecessor. The NewGen model aims to enhance comfort and performance.
insight: Enhanced cooling features boost gamer comfort and performance significantly.

title: Choose an Intel or AMD CPU and save up to $1200 on an RTX 5080-powered Omen Max 16 laptop high-end gaming just got cheaper
summary: Save up to $1200 on a high-end HP Omen Max 16 laptop, powered by an NVIDIA RTX 5080 GPU, when choosing between Intel and AMD CPUs.
insight: CPU choice unlocks significant discounts on high-end gaming laptops.

title: Trump administration to use Pentagon AI to set mineral reference prices gallium and germanium among first four targets
summary: The Trump administration plans to use AI tool OPEN to set mineral reference prices, focusing on strategically important rare earths like gallium and germanium.
insight: Uncovering true market values could disrupt China's rare earths market control.

title: Save $349 on a 9850X3D, bundled with 32GB of RAM and a motherboard at Newegg RAM effectively $150 when paired with X870E Aorus and AMD's fastest gaming chip
summary: Get an AMD Ryzen 9850X3D CPU, 32GB DDR5 RAM, and X870E Aorus motherboard at a discounted price of $349, effectively $150 off the cost of RAM when paired with an X870E Aorus and AMD's fastest gaming chip.
insight: Save money on RAM by bundling with a powerful gaming processor.

title: LG opens pre-orders for massive 52-inch 5K2K curved monitor $1,999 monster is built for both gaming and productivity, with 240Hz refresh rate
summary: LG's UltraGear evo G9 combines a 5K2K panel with a 240Hz refresh rate in a 52-inch curved monitor, targeting both gamers and productivity professionals.
insight: High-resolution, high-refresh gaming meets productivity demand for professionals.

title: Modder pushes rare 20GB RTX 3080 Ti past 550W with risky power shunts and liquid metal cooling project reveals full performance potential of the unreleased GPU sample
summary: A Reddit user modded an unreleased 20GB RTX 3080 Ti to bypass its power limits, maximizing its performance. The modder used power shunts and liquid metal cooling to push the GPU to over 550W. The result is a GPU that behaves like a 3080 Ti class GPU should be.
insight: Unlocking unreleased GPU potential reveals performance capabilities.

title: Lian Li SP1000P SFX power supply review: Exceptional power density in compact form
summary: The Lian Li SP1000P SFX offers exceptional power density in compact form. It delivers high performance despite its small size. Thermal management is a concern at maximum loads.
insight: High-performance power supply in a small SFX form factor matters.

title: MacBook Pro with OLED touch screen arriving in the fall, claims leaker new laptops to feature Dynamic Island and revamped UI optimized for both fingers and cursors
summary: Apple is reportedly releasing a touchscreen MacBook Pro later this year with a revamped UI optimized for both fingers and cursors.
insight: Seamless mouse and touch integration on macOS

title: Sambanova introduces new AI accelerator, partners with Intel to deploy Xeon CPUs for inferencing and agentic workloads Sambanova claims SN50 chip is three times more efficient than Nvidia B200
summary: SambaNova introduces the SN50 AI accelerator, claiming it's five times faster and three times more efficient than Nvidia's B200. The company partners with Intel to deploy Xeon CPUs for inferencing and agentic workloads. This move aims to provide enterprises and governments with more efficient AI systems.
insight: Efficient AI accelerators can significantly improve enterprise and government operations.

title: Tinkerer builds VR headset with CRTs repurposed from Sony Watchman makeshift VR rig isn't the sharpest, but eliminates screen-door effect
summary: A YouTuber repurposed Sony Watchman CRTs to build a makeshift VR headset, eliminating the screen-door effect.
insight: Repurposing old technology can create innovative and functional solutions.

title: Enterprising developer somehow writes an x86 CPU emulator in plain CSS no Javascript, no WASM, just stylesheet computing
summary: A developer leverages CSS to create a functioning x86 CPU emulator, pushing the boundaries of what is possible with the stylesheet language. This achievement showcases the creative potential of CSS beyond its traditional role in styling web pages. The emulator's functionality is made possible through the use of CSS combinators, pseudo-elements, and the `:has` selector.
insight: CSS is a powerful tool for computation beyond styling.

title: The world s first transatlantic fiber-optic cable is being ripped up after 37 years on the sea floor TAT-8 to be removed after entering service in 1988, broke in 2002
summary: TAT-8, the world's first transatlantic fiber-optic cable, is being removed after 37 years. Decommissioned in 2002, it was laid in 1988 and is now being hauled off the seabed near Portugal.
insight: Retrieval of old cables reduces risk of future environmental damage

title: Raspberry Pi CM5 mini-ITX-compatible carrier board features up to nine Ethernet ports for NVR, Smart Home, and Edge AI applications
summary: The EXAVIZ Cruiser is a Raspberry Pi CM5 carrier board offering up to nine Ethernet ports, ideal for NVRs, Smart Home gateways, and edge AI applications, providing connectivity options and expansion capabilities.
insight: Enhanced Ethernet connectivity for edge computing and IoT applications

title: Telink ML9118A A 32-bit RISC-V IoT module with Wi-Fi 6, Bluetooth 5.4, and 802.15.4 connectivity
summary: The Telink ML9118A is a 32-bit RISC-V IoT module offering Wi-Fi 6, Bluetooth 5.4, and 802.15.4 connectivity for smart home and IoT applications.
insight: Advances IoT connectivity with Wi-Fi 6, Bluetooth 5.4, and 802.15.4 support.

title: On edge? Go all-in with AI
summary: EMASS unveiled ECS-DoT, an SoC for AI inference on edge sensor data. This System-on-Chip (SoC) is designed to enable faster processing of sensor data at the edge. It aims to improve efficiency and real-time decision-making in various applications.
insight: Enabling real-time AI decision-making at the edge of networks.

title: US grid battery storage hits record, even as clean energy incentives are rolled back
summary: US grid battery storage capacity reached a record 57 GWh in 2023, enough to power five million homes. The industry expects a 21% increase to 70 GWh by the end of 2026. This growth is driven by expanding clean energy incentives.
insight: US grid battery storage capacity grows rapidly despite incentive rollbacks.

title: Someone built an x86 CPU emulator using pure CSS, for science
summary: Lyra Rebane's x86CSS project emulates an x86 processor using pure CSS, executing native 8086 machine code compiled from a C program. This innovative approach showcases the potential of CSS for complex computations and browser-based emulation. The x86CSS project can be accessed within a web browser.
insight: CSS can now execute native machine code in web browsers.

title: Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra's privacy screen is the most interesting upgrade this year
summary: The Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra's key upgrade is a privacy screen, which provides increased protection for users' sensitive information. The phone also features a customized version of Qualcomm's Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 SoC, offering improved CPU, GPU, and AI performance. This upgrade focuses on both performance and user security.
insight: Enhanced user security through advanced privacy screen technology.

title: YouTube adds downloads and background play to Premium Lite plan
summary: YouTube adds download and background play features to its Premium Lite plan as a result of user feedback, making it more appealing to free service users.
insight: Enhancing user experience to retain subscribers and attract free service users.

title: Sony's "soft pause" patent would let AI step in when players get distracted
summary: Sony's 'soft pause' patent allows AI to adjust game intensity for players who get distracted.
insight: Enhances gaming experience with seamless, adaptive AI support.

title: Apple is quietly assembling a US chip supply chain, one layer at a time
summary: Apple is building a US chip supply chain with TSMC in Arizona, with plans to purchase over 100 million chips this year. The complex will host six fabrication plants and supporting infrastructure. Apple is positioning itself as the anchor customer.
insight: Diversifying global chip supply to reduce dependence on Asian manufacturers.

title: Uber previews air taxi booking ahead of Dubai rollout with Joby
summary: Uber is previewing its air taxi booking system ahead of a Dubai rollout with Joby, positioning itself as the booking layer for future air services.
insight: Air taxi success hinges on seamless booking and operational integration.

title: New Android app alerts you when someone nearby is wearing smart glasses
summary: Nearby Glasses, an Android app, alerts users to smart glasses wearers nearby, based on Bluetooth Low Energy activity from specific manufacturers.
insight: Privacy concerns surrounding smart glasses usage gain new attention through proximity alerts.

title: OpenClaw creator says "vibe coding" is a slur against AI-assisted development
summary: The term 'vibe coding' is used to describe AI-assisted development, where developers rely on AI tools for code generation and modification.
insight: AI-assisted development is perceived as less skilled or legitimate coding practice.

title: This Quake-style shooter fits in just 64KB
summary: QUOD is a Quake-inspired shooter within a 64KB executable, showcasing efficient game design.
insight: Tiny executable size highlights exceptional compression and optimization techniques.

title: Washington tells Silicon Valley the Taiwan chip risk is no longer theoretical
summary: The US government warns of an imminent threat to its economy due to a potential disruption in Taiwan's chip supply, citing recent Chinese military drills and a projected economic shock comparable to the Great Depression.
insight: Taiwan's chip supply is a critical US economic vulnerability.

title: Apple set to launch first touchscreen MacBook Pro with OLED and Dynamic Island this year
summary: Apple is reportedly set to launch its first touchscreen MacBook Pro, featuring OLED and Dynamic Island. This marks a shift in the company's stance on combining touchscreens with laptops. The new device is expected to be released this year.
insight: Apple's touchscreen MacBook Pro could revolutionize laptop design and functionality.

title: Death Stranding 2 on PC adds Guerrilla's Pico upscaler alongside DLSS and FSR
summary: Death Stranding 2 on PC will support various graphics options, including DLSS and FSR. The game requires at least a GeForce GTX 1660 or AMD RX 5500 XT to run. A handheld graphics preset will be available in the game's options menu.
insight: Death Stranding 2 prioritizes accessibility with diverse graphics options.

title: Farmers are rejecting massive offers as AI data centers hunt for land
summary: Tech firms are racing to secure 'powered land' for AI and cloud computing. Large parcels with access to electricity, water, and favorable zoning are in high demand. Farmers are rejecting massive offers in response.
insight: Tech demand disrupts traditional land use and agricultural practices.
